Post.title: Docker - Dockerfile
Post._content:
Docker  PHP Conference China 2015 "SaaS " Docker Docker 




 Docker Dockerfile  Dockerfile  Dockerfile 



# 



Dockerfile  # 

Dockerfile 

<!-- more --> 



``` 

# This dockerfile uses the ubuntu image

# VERSION 2 - EDITION 1

# Author: docker_user

# Command format: Instruction [arguments / command] ..



# Base image to use, this must be set as the first line

FROM ubuntu



# Maintainer: docker_user <docker_user at email.com> (@docker_user)

MAINTAINER docker_user docker_user@email.com



# Commands to update the image

RUN echo "deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ raring main universe" >> /etc/apt/sources.list

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y nginx

RUN echo "\ndaemon off;" >> /etc/nginx/nginx.conf



# Commands when creating a new container

CMD /usr/sbin/nginx

```





 RUN RUN  RUN 



 CMD 





```

# Nginx

#

# VERSION               0.0.1



FROM      ubuntu

MAINTAINER Victor Vieux <victor@docker.com>



RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y inotify-tools nginx apache2 openssh-server



# Firefox over VNC

#

# VERSION               0.3



FROM ubuntu



# Install vnc, xvfb in order to create a 'fake' display and firefox

RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y x11vnc xvfb firefox

RUN mkdir /.vnc

# Setup a password

RUN x11vnc -storepasswd 1234 ~/.vnc/passwd

# Autostart firefox (might not be the best way, but it does the trick)

RUN bash -c 'echo "firefox" >> /.bashrc'



EXPOSE 5900

CMD    ["x11vnc", "-forever", "-usepw", "-create"]



# Multiple images example

#

# VERSION               0.1



FROM ubuntu

RUN echo foo > bar

# Will output something like ===> 907ad6c2736f



FROM ubuntu

RUN echo moo > oink

# Will output something like ===> 695d7793cbe4



# Youll now have two images, 907ad6c2736f with /bar, and 695d7793cbe4 with

# /oink.

```



# 



 INSTRUCTION arguments FROMMAINTAINERRUN 



## FROM



 FROM `<image>`  FROM `<image>:<tag>` 

 FROM Dockerfile FROM 



## MAINTAINER



 MAINTAINER `<name>`



## RUN



 RUN `<command>`  RUN ["executable", "param1", "param2"]



 shell  /bin/sh -c exec  RUN ["/bin/bash", "-c", "echo hello"]



 RUN  \ 



## CMD





* CMD ["executable","param1","param2"]  exec 

* CMD command param1 param2  /bin/sh 

* CMD ["param1","param2"]  ENTRYPOINT 



 Dockerfile  CMD 



 CMD 



## EXPOSE



 EXPOSE `<port> [<port>...]`



 Docker  -PDocker 



## ENV



 ENV `<key> <value>`  RUN 





```

ENV PG_MAJOR 9.3

ENV PG_VERSION 9.3.4

RUN curl -SL http://example.com/postgres-$PG_VERSION.tar.xz | tar -xJC /usr/src/postgress && 

ENV PATH /usr/local/postgres-$PG_MAJOR/bin:$PATH

```



## ADD



 ADD `<src> <dest>`



 `<src>`  `<dest>`  `<src>` Dockerfile URL tar 



## COPY



 COPY `<src> <dest>`

 `<src>` Dockerfile  `<dest>`

 COPY



## ENTRYPOINT





* ENTRYPOINT ["executable", "param1", "param2"]

* ENTRYPOINT command param1 param2shell

 docker run 

 Dockerfile  ENTRYPOINT



## VOLUME



 VOLUME ["/data"]





## USER



 USER daemon

 UID RUN 

RUN groupadd -r postgres && useradd -r -g postgres postgres gosu sudo



## WORKDIR



 WORKDIR /path/to/workdir

 RUNCMDENTRYPOINT 

 WORKDIR 



```

WORKDIR /a

WORKDIR b

WORKDIR c

RUN pwd

```

 /a/b/c



## ONBUILD



 ONBUILD [INSTRUCTION]



Dockerfile  image-A

```

[...]

ONBUILD ADD . /app/src

ONBUILD RUN /usr/local/bin/python-build --dir /app/src

[...]

```



 image-A Dockerfile FROM image-A

ONBUILD 



```

FROM image-A



#Automatically run the following

ADD . /app/src

RUN /usr/local/bin/python-build --dir /app/src

```



 ONBUILD  ruby:1.9-onbuild

``` 
# This dockerfile uses the ubuntu image

# Base image to use, this must be set as the first line

FROM ubuntu



# Maintainer: docker_user <docker_user at email.com> (@docker_user)
```

```

# Nginx

MAINTAINER Victor Vieux <victor@docker.com>

# Install vnc, xvfb in order to create a 'fake' display and firefox

RUN mkdir /.vnc

# Setup a password

FROM ubuntu
```

Post.title: Sublime Text
Post._content:
## : * SideBarEnhancements * HTML-CSS-JS Prettify * SublimeCodeIntel * Emmet ## SideBarEnhancements Sublime TexthtmlOpen In Browser. SideBarEnhancements ### : `Package Control->Install Package` `sidebarenhancements` ### : ( ) htmljscss `Open With` `Edit Applications` : ``` [ {"id": "side-bar-files-open-with", "children": [ { "caption": "Firefox", "id": "side-bar-files-open-with-chrome", "command": "side_bar_files_open_with", "args": { "paths": [], "application": "/Applications/Firefox.app", // Windows.exe "extensions":".*", "args":[] }, "open_automatically" : false }, { "caption": "Chrome", "id": "side-bar-files-open-with-chrome", "command": "side_bar_files_open_with", "args": { "paths": [], "application": "/Applications/Chrome.app", //Chrome Windows.exe "extensions":".*", "args":[] }, "open_automatically" : false }, //. { "caption": "Safari", "id": "side-bar-files-open-with-chrome", "command": "side_bar_files_open_with", "args": { "paths": [], "application": "/Applications/Safari.app", //Safari Windows.exe "extensions":".*", "args":[] }, "open_automatically" : false } ] } ] ``` ### : ( ) `Preferences` `Key Bindings - User` : ``` //keys F2Firefox [ { "keys": ["f2"], "command": "side_bar_files_open_with", "args": { "paths": [], "application": "/Applications/Firefox.app", //Firefox "extensions":".*" } }, { "keys": ["f1"], "command": "side_bar_files_open_with", "args": { "paths": [], "application": "/Applications/Safari.app", //Safari "extensions":".*" } }, //. { "keys": ["f4"], "command": "side_bar_files_open_with", "args": { "paths": [], "application": "/Applications/Chrome.app", //Chrome "extensions":".*" } } ] ``` `F1` Safari`F2` Firefox`F4` Chrome ## HTML-CSS-JS Prettify ### : `Package Control->Install Package` `HTML-CSS-JS Prettify` ### : * `Cmd+Shift+H` (Windows `Ctrl+Shift+H`). * sh: node: command not foundnodenode. LinuxMacWindowsnode_path. * PreferencesBrowse PackagesHTML-CSS-JS PrettifyHTMLPrettify.sublime-settingsSublime Textwindowsnode ### : ( ) . `Preferences` `Key Bindings - User`: `{ "keys": ["alt+q"], "command": "htmlprettify" }` . ### : ( ) `Preferences` `Package Settings` `HTML/CSS/JS Prettify` `Set Prettify Preferences` .. github(github).jsbeautifyrc ## SublimeCodeIntel : `JavaScript, Mason, XBL, XUL, RHTML, SCSS, Python, HTML, Ruby, Python3, XML, Sass, XSLT, Django,HTML5, Perl, CSS, Twig, Less, Smarty, Node.js, Tcl, TemplateToolkit, PHP` . ### : `Package Control->Install Package` `SublimeCodeIntel` . (VPN) ### : `Preferences->Package Settings->SublimeCodeIntel->Setting Default` `Setting User` . `Command+F` ( `ctrl+F` ) `codeintel_selected_catalogs`: ``` "codeintel_selected_catalogs": [ "HTML5", "HTML", "JavaScript" ], ``` ### : * `d` `div tag` `div tag` : ```html
``` `div.class` `div#id` `Tab` ```html
``` 2 `Emmet` `Emmet` 1 ## Emmet `Emmet` ( `Zen Coding` ): ### : `Package Control->Install Package` `Emmet` . ### : `class` `id` `SublimeCodeIntel` 2 `SublimeCodeIntel` : `ul>li*5` `Tab` : ```html
``` ******Google** [](http://docs.emmet.io/). ### : Emmetmac `Canmand+D` (). `Cammand+D(Ctrl+d)` `Preferences->Key Bindings - User` : ``` { "keys": ["command+shift+d"], "command":"find_under_expand" }, { "keys": ["command+d"], "command":"run_macro_file", "args": {"file":"Packages/Default/Delete Line.sublime-macro"} } // command+shift+dcommand+d ```

Post.title: Redux
Post._content:
# Redux 

>  [Redux ](http://rackt.github.io/redux/)  Redux 



## 

statestate  UI  tab state state  bug



Redux  state 



* state  store 

* state 

*  reducer  state 



> state  Redux state  dispatch(action)  reducer 

<!-- more -->

## ActionsReducers  Store

action  store : [Flux Standard Action](https://github.com/acdlite/flux-standard-action/) Redux  Action Creator:

```javascript

function addTodo(text) {

    return {

        type: ADD_TODO,

        text,

    }

}

store.dispatch(addTodo(text))

```



> dispatch(action)  reducer  state ->  store  dispatch fetch action data Middleware 



reducer `(previousState, action) => newState`

 action  state  combineReducers(reducers)  reducer  root reducer



> reducer  state, reducer  state ,  state  [immutable-js](http://facebook.github.io/immutable-js/)



store 

*  state

*  `store.getState()`  state

*  `store.dispatch(action)`  state 

*  `store.subscribe(listener)`  state 

*  `createStore(reducer, [initialState])` 



>  Redux  store  combineReducers(reducers)  state  reducer



## Middleware

middleware  dispatch  dispatch`newDispatch = middleware1(middleware2(...(dispatch)...))` 

```javascript

// thunk-middleware

export default function thunkMiddleware({ dispatch, getState }) {

    return next => action =>

        typeof action === 'function' ? action(dispatch, getState) : next(action)

}

```



 thunk-middleware  dispatch  getState state  `dispatch new action` `next(action)`thunk-middleware  dispatch  actionstore 

```javascript

// thunk-middleware

const reducer = combineReducers(reducers)

const finalCreateStore = applyMiddleware(promiseMiddleware, warningMiddleware,

    loggerMiddleWare)(createStore)

const store = finalCreateStore(reducer)

```



##  Actions

ajaxdispatch(action)  action [redux-thunks](https://github.com/gaearon/redux-thunk/)  [redux-promise](https://github.com/aclite/redux-promise/)  Promise  action 



## Redux  Flux 

![Flux](http://7xnvp3.com1.z0.glb.clouddn.com/bVoR1E.jpg)

![Redux](http://7xnvp3.com1.z0.glb.clouddn.com/bVoR1G.jpg)

 [UNIDIRECTIONAL USER INTERFACE ARCHITECTURES](http://staltz.com/unidirectional-user-interface-architectures.html)



## Redux  React

Redux  React Redux  state View Redux  `state => UI` React, Deku



> Smart component`  Redux @connectDumb component  redux  store redux state -> Smart component -> Dumb component -> Dumb component props  Dumb component  UI  unmount  UI Smart component  route handlers  Smart component Smart component  reducer

<!-- more -->

## ActionsReducers  Store

action  store : [Flux Standard Action](https://github.com/acdlite/flux-standard-action/) Redux  Action Creator:

```javascript

function addTodo(text) {

    return {

        type: ADD_TODO,

        text,

    }

}

store.dispatch(addTodo(text))

```



> dispatch(action)  reducer  state ->  store  dispatch fetch action data Middleware 



reducer `(previousState, action) => newState`

 action  state  combineReducers(reducers)  reducer  root reducer



> reducer  state, reducer  state ,  state  [immutable-js](http://facebook.github.io/immutable-js/)



store 

*  state

*  `store.getState()`  state

*  `store.dispatch(action)`  state 

*  `store.subscribe(listener)`  state 

*  `createStore(reducer, [initialState])` 



>  Redux  store  combineReducers(reducers)  state  reducer



## Middleware

middleware  dispatch  dispatch`newDispatch = middleware1(middleware2(...(dispatch)...))` 

```javascript

// thunk-middleware

export default function thunkMiddleware({ dispatch, getState }) {

    return next => action =>

        typeof action === 'function' ? action(dispatch, getState) : next(action)

}

```



 thunk-middleware  dispatch  getState state  `dispatch new action` `next(action)`thunk-middleware  dispatch  actionstore 

```javascript

// thunk-middleware

const reducer = combineReducers(reducers)

const finalCreateStore = applyMiddleware(promiseMiddleware, warningMiddleware,

    loggerMiddleWare)(createStore)

const store = finalCreateStore(reducer)

```



##  Actions

ajaxdispatch(action)  action [redux-thunks](https://github.com/gaearon/redux-thunk/)  [redux-promise](https://github.com/aclite/redux-promise/)  Promise  action

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content: Welcome to [Hexo](http://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](http://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](http://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues). ## Quick Start ### Create a new post ``` bash $ hexo new "My New Post" ``` More info: [Writing](http://hexo.io/docs/writing.html) ### Run server ``` bash $ hexo server ``` More info: [Server](http://hexo.io/docs/server.html) ### Generate static files ``` bash $ hexo generate ``` More info: [Generating](http://hexo.io/docs/generating.html) ### Deploy to remote sites ``` bash $ hexo deploy ``` More info: [Deployment](http://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html) JS Bin on jsbin.com
Post.raw: title: Hello World date: 2014-10-17 20:55:32 tags: hello --- Welcome to [Hexo](http://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](http://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](http://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues). ## Quick Start ### Create a new post ``` bash $ hexo new "My New Post" ``` More info: [Writing](http://hexo.io/docs/writing.html) ### Run server ``` bash $ hexo server ``` More info: [Server](http://hexo.io/docs/server.html) ### Generate static files ``` bash $ hexo generate ``` More info: [Generating](http://hexo.io/docs/generating.html) ### Deploy to remote sites ``` bash $ hexo deploy ``` More info: [Deployment](http://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html) JS Bin on jsbin.com
